CandDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
Contributions exceeding $1000 made not more than 25 days before election and not less than forty-eight hours before election must be reported in a supplemental large contribution report not more than forty-eight hours after the contribution is received.

By the third Wednesday in each January following an election year, committees must file a report covering the period from 15 days before the election to Decemeber 31 of the election year.

CandDonorExplain: Candidates who received $1000 or less in contributions during a reporting period must still report if one contributor, other than the candidate himself or herself, contributed > $250 or made expenditures > $1000.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Receipts of contribution or loan of $1001 or more made between 7 days before election and election shall be reported to the appropriate officer within forty-eight hours after receipt. The reports required to be filed not later than 7 days before election and not later than 30 days after election must be cumulative so as to reflect the total receipts and disbursements of the reporting committee for the entire election campaign in question.
PartyDonorExplain: Political party committees that received $1000 or less in contributions during a reporting period must still report if one contributor contributed $250 or more.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Receipts of contribution or loan of $501 or more made between 7 days before election and election shall be reported to the appropriate officer within forty-eight hours after receipt.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Receipts of contribution or loan of $501 or more made between the filing of the last quarterly report required prior to an election and the election shall be reported to the appropriate officer within forty-eight hours after receipt.

CandDonorExplain: Candidates who received $500 or less in contributions during a reporting period must still report if one contributor, other than the candidate himself or herself, contributed > $250 or made expenditures > $500.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
The receipt of any late contribution or loan of no more than the limits described in section 130.032 by a candidate committee supporting a candidate for statewide office or by any other committee shall be reported to the appropriate officer no later than forty-eight hours after receipt. For purposes of this subsection the term "late contribution or loan" means a contribution or loan received after the closing date of the last disclosure report required to be filed before an election but received prior to the date of the election itself. 

The reports required to be filed not later than 7 days before election and not later than 30 days after election must be cumulative so as to reflect the total receipts and disbursements of the reporting committee for the entire election campaign in question.
PartyDonorExplain: Any committee that received contributions of or made expenditures of less than $500 is still required to report if it received contributions of more than $250 from any single donor.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: The receipt of any contribution or loan after the closing date of the last disclosure report  required to be filed before an election, but before the date of the election, must be reported to the appropriate filing officer within 48 hours after receipt.
PACDonorExplain: Any committee that received contributions of or made expenditures of less than $500 is still required to report if it received contributions of more than $250 from any single donor.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: The receipt of any contribution or loan after the closing date of the last disclosure report  required to be filed before an election, but before the date of the election, must be reported to the appropriate filing officer within 48 hours after receipt.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: A political committee shall file a report of any contribution of $ 1,000 or more electronically with the Board within 5 business days after receipt of the contribution, except that the report shall be filed within 2 business days after receipt if (i) the contribution is received 30 or fewer days before the date of an election and (ii) the political committee supports or opposes a candidate or public question on the ballot at that election or makes expenditures in excess of $ 500 on behalf of or in opposition to a candidate, candidates, a public question, or public questions on the ballot at that election.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
Contributions aggregating $ 1,000 or more from any one contributor
     or single expenditures of $ 1,000 or more, made after the 12th day
     before the election, and more than 48 hours before 5 p.m. on the day
     of the election, must be reported within 48 hours of those
     contributions or expenditures or by noon of the first business day
     after the contributions or expenditures, whichever is later.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: A contrubution or expenditure over a $1,000 after 12 days before and election must be reported in 48 hours.

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: 1979 N.M. Laws ch. 360 §§2, 3, 7; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-26; 1-19-27[A]; 1-19-31; Session Law: 1993 N.M. Laws ch. 46 §5; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-29;
CandDonorExplain: Note: Minimum amount for disclosure is $1000 for non-statewide and $2,500 for statewide election.  Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
(1) Candidates must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in May for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday in May. Annual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) Candidates, during an election year, (including May report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(c) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.

If no candidate has not received any contributions or made any expenditures, a statement of no activity may be filed in lieu of a report, in which case a full report is not required until the next required filing date following an expenditure or receipt of contribution.
PartyDonorExplain: Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine:
(1) Party must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in May for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday in May. Annual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) Party, during an election year, (including May report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(c) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.
PACDonorExplain: Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
(1) PAC must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in May for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday in May. Annual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) PAC, during an election year, (including May report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(c) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.

PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
(1) PAC must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in May for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday in May. Annual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) PAC, during an election year, (including May report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(c) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: 1979 N.M. Laws ch. 360 §§2, 3, 7,  9; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-26; 1-19-27[A]; 1-19-31; 1-19-33[A]; Session Law: 1993 N.M. Laws ch. 46 §5; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-29;
CandDonorExplain: Note: Minimum amount for disclosure is $1000 for non-statewide and $2,500 for statewide election. Candidate must file for exception if below these. Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions aggregating $ 1,000 or more from any one contributor or single expenditures of $ 1,000 or more, made after the 12th day before the election, and more than 48 hours before 5 p.m. on the day of the election, must be reported within 48 hours of those contributions or expenditures or by noon of the first business day after the contributions or expenditures, whichever is later.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: A contrubution or expenditure over a $1,000 after 12 days before and election must be reported in 48 hours.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions aggregating $ 1,000 or more from any one contributor or single expenditures of $ 1,000 or more, made after the 12th day before the election, and more than 48 hours before 5 p.m. on the day of the election, must be reported within 48 hours of those contributions or expenditures or by noon of the first business day after the contributions or expenditures, whichever is later.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine:
A committee shall report any single contribution of $ 5,000 or
     more received or single expenditure of $ 1,000 or more made after the
     14th day before the election and more than 24 hours before 5:00 p.m.
     on the day of the election within 24 hours of that contribution or
     expenditure.

CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained:
A contribution received by a person, candidate or reporting entity from another person or entity with the understanding that the contribution is to be passed on to another candidate or reporting entity.
If this occurs, and the intermediate recipient is not a reporting entity, the intermediate recipient must inform the ultimate recipient of the original source of the contribution. If the intermediate recipient is a reporting entity, the intermediate recipient must not only inform the ultimate recipient of the original source of the contribution, but must also reflect in his or her own report from whom the contribution was originally received and for whose benefit the contribution was given. The ultimate recipient must report the original source of the contribution as well as the intermediate recipient’s role in receiving and passing on the contribution. Earmarked contributions are subject to all applicable contribution limits.

CandDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions exceeding $1000 made not more than 25 days before election and not less than forty-eight hours before election must be reported in a supplemental large contribution report not more than forty-eight hours after the contribution is received.
PartyDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
PACDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
second day before election day:
(1)  a candidate for state senator who has an opponent whose name is to
   appear on the ballot and who accepts political contributions from a
   person that in the aggregate exceed $ 1,000 during that reporting
   period;
(2)  a candidate for state representative who has an opponent whose name
   is to appear on the ballot and who accepts political contributions from
   a person that in the aggregate exceed $ 200 during that reporting
   period;
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: A statewide officeholder, a member of the legislature, or a specific-purpose committee for supporting, opposing, or assisting a statewide officeholder or member of the legislature, or a candidate for statewide office or the legislature or a specific-purpose committee for supporting or opposing the candidate, that accepts a political contribution during the period beginning on the date the governor signs the proclamation calling a special legislative session and continuing through the date of final adjournment shall report the contribution to the commission not later than the 30th day after the date of final adjournment.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine:
If a general-purpose committee makes a political expenditure in the form of a political contribution to another general-purpose committee or to an out-of-state political committee and the contributing committee does not intend that the contribution be used in connection with a particular election, the contributing committee shall include the expenditure in the first report required to be filed under this subchapter after the expenditure is made.

(a)  In addition to other reports required by this chapter, a general-purpose committee that makes direct campaign expenditures supporting or opposing either a single candidate that in the aggregate exceed $ 1,000 or a group of candidates that in the aggregate exceed $ 15,000 during the period beginning the ninth day before election day and ending at 12 noon on the second day before election day shall file a report by telegram or telephonic facsimile machine or by hand with the commission not later than 48 hours after the expenditure is made.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
second day before election day:
(1)  a candidate for state senator who has an opponent whose name is to
   appear on the ballot and who accepts political contributions from a
   person that in the aggregate exceed $ 1,000 during that reporting
   period;
(2)  a candidate for state representative who has an opponent whose name
   is to appear on the ballot and who accepts political contributions from
   a person that in the aggregate exceed $ 200 during that reporting
   period;
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: A statewide officeholder, a member of the legislature, or a specific-purpose committee for supporting, opposing, or assisting a statewide officeholder or member of the legislature, or a candidate for statewide office or the legislature or a specific-purpose committee for supporting or opposing the candidate, that accepts a political contribution during the period beginning on the date the governor signs the proclamation calling a special legislative session and continuing through the date of final adjournment shall report the contribution to the commission not later than the 30th day after the date of final adjournment.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine:
If a general-purpose committee makes a political expenditure in the form of a political contribution to another general-purpose committee or to an out-of-state political committee and the contributing committee does not intend that the contribution be used in connection with a particular election, the contributing committee shall include the expenditure in the first report required to be filed under this subchapter after the expenditure is made.

(a)  In addition to other reports required by this chapter, a general-purpose committee that makes direct campaign expenditures supporting or opposing either a single candidate that in the aggregate exceed $ 1,000 or a group of candidates that in the aggregate exceed $ 15,000 during the period beginning the ninth day before election day and ending at 12 noon on the second day before election day shall file a report by telegram or telephonic facsimile machine or by hand with the commission not later than 48 hours after the expenditure is made.

second day before election day:
(1)  a candidate for state senator who has an opponent whose name is to

   period;
(2)  a candidate for state representative who has an opponent whose name

   period;
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: A statewide officeholder, a member of the legislature, or a specific-purpose committee for supporting, opposing, or assisting a statewide officeholder or member of the legislature, or a candidate for statewide office or the legislature or a specific-purpose committee for supporting or opposing the candidate, that accepts a political contribution during the period beginning on the date the governor signs the proclamation calling a special legislative session and continuing through the date of final adjournment shall report the contribution to the commission not later than the 30th day after the date of final adjournment.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: principal campaign committee shall file a report disclosing the receipt of any single contribution of twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) or more within two days.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: political action committee shall file a report disclosing the receipt of any single contribution of twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) or more within two days.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution of $500 or more received in the interim between the last date of the period covered by the last report filed prior to the election and the date of the election shall be reported within 2 business days after its receipt.

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: 1979 N.M. Laws ch. 360 §§2, 3, 7,  9; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-26; 1-19-27[A]; 1-19-31; 1-19-33[A]; Session Law: 1993 N.M. Laws ch. 46 §5; Current Code: 1978 N.M.S.A. §§1-19-29;
CandDonorExplain: Note: Minimum amount for disclosure is $1000 for non-statewide and $2,500 for statewide election. Candidate must file for exception if below these. Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
(1) Candidates must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in May for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday in May. Annual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) Candidates, during an election year, (including May report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(c) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.
PartyDonorExplain: Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.

If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(d) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.

If no candidate has not received any contributions or made any expenditures, a statement of no activity may be filed in lieu of a report, in which case a full report is not required until the next required filing date following an expenditure or receipt of contribution.

PACDonorExplain: Contributor's occupation must be reported if aggregated contribution of more than $250 per election.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
(1) PAC must report annually by 5:00 p.m. on second Monday in April and October for all expenditures made or contributions received by 5:00 p.m. on First Monday of that month. Biannual reports must be reported regardless of whether expenditures were made or contributions were received. 
(2) PAC, during an election year, (including April and October report) must report: 
(a) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in May for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in May and not previously reported. 
(b) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in September for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in September and not previously reported.
(c) by 5:00 p.m. on 2nd Monday in October for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 1st Monday in October and not previously reported.
(d) by 5 p.m. on Thursday before election for expenditures made or contributions received on or before 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election and not previously reported. 
(e) If contributions received after 5:00 p.m. on Tuesday before election (i) for non-statewide office and the contribution is $500 or more or (ii) for statewide office and the contribution is $2,500 or more, then a supplemental report must be filed within 24 hours of receipt. If received after 5:00 p.m. on Friday before election, report is not required until 12 noon on Monday before election. 
(f) by 5:00 p.m. on the  30th day after election for all contributions received or expenditures made on or before the 25th day after election and not previously reported.

CandDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions exceeding $1000 made not more than 25 days before election and not less than forty-eight hours before election must be reported in a supplemental large contribution report not more than forty-eight hours after the contribution is received.
PartyDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.

CandDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
Contributions exceeding $1000 made not more than 25 days before election and not less than forty-eight hours before election must be reported in a supplemental large contribution report not more than forty-eight hours after the contribution is received.

By the third Wednesday in each January following an election year, committees must file a report covering the period from 15 days before the election to Decemeber 31 of the election year.

CandDonorExplain: OCCUPATION AND EMPLOYER= $101. Candidates who received $500 or less in contributions during a reporting period must still report if one contributor, other than the candidate himself or herself, contributed > $250 or made expenditures > $500.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
The receipt of any late contribution or loan of no more than the limits described in section 130.032 by a candidate committee supporting a candidate for statewide office or by any other committee shall be reported to the appropriate officer no later than forty-eight hours after receipt. For purposes of this subsection the term "late contribution or loan" means a contribution or loan received after the closing date of the last disclosure report required to be filed before an election but received prior to the date of the election itself. 

The reports required to be filed not later than 8 days before election and not later than 30 days after election must be cumulative so as to reflect the total receipts and disbursements of the reporting committee for the entire election campaign in question.
PartyDonorExplain: OCCUPATION AND EMPLOYER= $101. Any committee that received contributions of or made expenditures of less than $500 is still required to report if it received contributions of more than $250 from any single donor.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: The receipt of any contribution or loan after the closing date of the last disclosure report  required to be filed before an election, but before the date of the election, must be reported to the appropriate filing officer within 48 hours after receipt.
PACDonorExplain: OCCUPATION AND EMPLOYER= $101. Any committee that received contributions of or made expenditures of less than $500 is still required to report if it received contributions of more than $250 from any single donor.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: The receipt of any contribution or loan after the closing date of the last disclosure report  required to be filed before an election, but before the date of the election, must be reported to the appropriate filing officer within 48 hours after receipt.

CandDonorExplain: OCCUPATION AND EMPLOYER THRESHOLD= $101. Candidates who received $500 or less in contributions during a reporting period must still report if one contributor, other than the candidate himself or herself, contributed > $325 or made expenditures > $500.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
The receipt of any late contribution or loan of more than $250 by a candidate committee supporting a candidate for statewide office or by any other committee shall be reported to the appropriate officer no later than twenty-four hours after receipt. "Late contribution or loan" means a contribution or loan received after the closing date of the last disclosure report required to be filed before an election but received prior to the date of the election itself. 

The reports required to be filed not later than 8 days before election and not later than 30 days after election must be cumulative so as to reflect the total receipts and disbursements of the reporting committee for the entire election campaign in question.

CandDonorExplain: If donor is not individual, threshold for disclosure of name/address of responsible person is $1201.
PartyDonorExplain: Name and address of each political committee from which the political committee received ANY transfer of funds must be disclosed. If donor is not individual, threshold for disclosure of name/address of responsible person is $1201.
Entity_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: Any person who makes an independent expenditure aggregating more than $100 after the 20th day, but more than 1 day, before any election shall, within 24 hours after such independent expenditure is made, file with the Commissioner a report.

PartyDonorExplain: Name and address of each political committee from which the political committee received ANY transfer of funds must be disclosed.
Entity_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: If more than 30 days before special election/primary or more than 60 days before general election, within 48 hrs of IE.  If within those time periods, within 24 hours of IE.

CandDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
PartyDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.
PACDonorExplain: Committee must disclose the person's occupation, if the person is an individual who has made contributions of at least one thousand dollars ($1,000) during the calendar year.

Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

CandDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution received by a candidate with opposition in an election or by the campaign treasurer or a deputy campaign treasurer of such a candidate on the day of that election or less than 5 days prior to the day of that election must be returned by him or her to the person or committee contributing it and may not be used or expended by or on behalf of the candidate.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.
PartyDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Party_PreElection_Regular: Friday before election
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution received by a state or county executive committee or affiliated party committee less than 5 days before an election shall not be used or expended in behalf of any candidate, issue, affiliated party committee, or political party participating in such election.
PartyFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.
PACDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution received by the chair, campaign treasurer, or deputy campaign treasurer of a political committee supporting or opposing a candidate with opposition in an election or supporting or opposing an issue on the ballot in an election on the day of that election or less than 5 days prior to the day of that election may not be obligated or expended by the committee until after the date of the election.
PACFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $200 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: a report within 24 hours of making an expenditure or incurring a debt or obligation of $ 500 or more for election material described in 13-35-225(1)  (advertising materials advocating success or defeat of candidate/politcal party/ballot issue) if made between the 17th day before the election and the day of the election
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
PACs supporting statewide candidates = within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $200 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
PACs supporting or opposing ballot issues = within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $500 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
PACs supporting the legislature, the public service commission, or a district court judge, and political committees that are specifically organized to support or oppose a particular state district candidate = within 48 hours after receiving a contribution of $100 or more if received between the 17th day before the election and the day of the election

Independent Committees (includes political party committees) = a report within 24 hours of making an expenditure or incurring a debt or obligation of $500 or more for election material described in 13-35-225(1) (advertising materials advocating success or defeat of candidate/politcal party/ballot issue) if made between the 17th day before the election and the day of the election

PAC_PreElection_Regular: Varies. Must file on 10/19
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Report on 1/19, but if a committee of a candidate for: governor receives $10,000 or more; statewide office receives $5,000 or more; or general assembly receives $1,000 or more after the close of the last disclosure report, then candidate must file a special report on the Friday immediately preceding that election that is current through the Tuesday immediately preceding the election.

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000

Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000. These obligations all apply to spending on recall elections.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: A candidate's campaign committee shall give notice of contributions of at least 1,000 dollars made within twenty days before the election. The notice shall be filed within 72 hours after receipt of the contribution and shall include the date of receipt, the name of the contributor and the amount of the contribution.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: Contributions made less than 20 days before an election that are $25,001 for a statewide ballot measure; $2,501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population equal to or greater than 100,000; and $501 for a local ballot measure in a jurisdiction with a population less than 100,000. These obligations all apply to spending on recall elections.

CandDonorExplain: While candidates must disclose this information, there is no prohibition on depositing a contribution if the donor does not supply all of the information.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Late contributions must be reported within 24 hours of receipt or, in the case of contributions by candidates or committees, when the contribution was made. Late contributions are those of $1,000 or more. Any candidate or committee that makes a late in-kind contribution must notify the recipient in writing of the value of the contribution.

CandDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: $21 = Name, address, amount contributed, and date of contribution; $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions of $200 or more received after the closing date of the pre-election filing period (the closing date is the 16th day before the election) but received before the second day before the election, must be reported within 48 hours of reciept. The report must include name, address, occupation and employer, and the report must be written but need not contain an original signature.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: "A contribution which is controlled by, or made at the direction of, another person, including a parent organization, subsidiary, division, committee, department, branch, or local unit of a person, shall be reported by the person making the contribution, and shall be regarded as a contribution attributable to both persons for purposes of contribution limits."
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Each fundraising event requires a special report, including the type of event, the date held, the address of the venue, the number of people in attendance, and the associated expenditures
PartyDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: $21 = Name, amount contributed, and date of contribution (if the person is not an individual, but a committee, then you must also include the address); $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business

CandDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: For all contributions = Name, address, amount contributed, and date of contribution; $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions of $200 or more received after the closing date of the pre-election filing period (the closing date is the 16th day before the election) but received before the second day before the election, must be reported within 48 hours of reciept. CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Contributions controlled by, or made at the direction of, another person, shall reported by the person making the contribution, and shall be regarded as a contribution attributable to both persons for purposes of contribution limits. Bundled contributions, or a contribution that is delivered as part of a bundled contribution, shall be reported as both a contribution attributable to the bundling committee that delivered the contribution and a contribution attributable to the individual making the contribution. Bundling committees must submit reports to both the Secretary of State and the candidate committee with the details of the contributions contained within a bundled contribution.

BallotFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Contributions controlled by, or made at the direction of, another person, shall reported by the person making the contribution, and shall be regarded as a contribution attributable to both persons for purposes of contribution limits. Bundled contributions, or a contribution that is delivered as part of a bundled contribution, shall be reported as both a contribution attributable to the bundling committee that delivered the contribution and a contribution attributable to the individual making the contribution. Bundling committees must submit reports to the Secretary of State with the details of the contributions contained within a bundled contribution.

CandDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: For all contributions = Name, address, amount contributed, and date of contribution; $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions of $200 or more received after the closing date of the pre-election filing period (the closing date is the 16th day before the election) but received before the second day before the election, must be reported within 48 hours of reciept. Bundling committees must submit reports to both the Secretary of State and the candidate committee with the details of the contributions contained within a bundled contribution.

Disclosure_Citation: 1977 Idaho Sess. Laws  § 180 (Idaho Code. Ann. § 67-6612 (2014)); 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws  ch. 229 (Idaho Code Ann.  §  67-6610 (2014)); 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws  ch. 379 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6607 (2014)); 1999 Idaho Sess. Laws 29 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6611 (2014)).
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Entity_DonorDisclose_Citation: 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws Ch. 379 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6606 (2014))

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: MN Laws 1974, c. 470, § 15; Current Code: MN ST §10A.15; 10A.20; 10A.16; 10A.02
CandDonorExplain: Occupation is only required if the contributor is self-employed.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution in excess of 2,000 for a statewide election or $400 for a legislative election received after the last report must be reported within 48 hours of receipt, either in person or certified mail. This does not apply to a primary if candidate is unopposed.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: A candidate or PAC shall not accept an earmarked contribution (a contribution from a source with the express or implied condition that the contribution be directed to a candidate other than the original recipeint).

Disclosure_Citation: 2002 Md. Laws, Chap. 291, §4; Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Businesses that have business with the state, a county, or incorporated municipality involving consideration of $100,000 or more on a cumulative basis entered into during the 12 months immediately preceding the end of the reporting period are required to report all contributions to an incumbent or candidate political committee in excess of $100. This included the purchase of tickets, payment for admission to a dinner, BBQ, fish fry, or similar event, except for a bona fide gift by a spouse or relative within the 3rd degree of consanguinity, or honorary memberships in a social, service, or fraternal organization presented as a courtesy by the organization.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.

Disclosure_Citation: Old Code: Md. Ann. Code. art. 33 §§ 26-3, 26-4, 26-11, 30-1 et seq., 30-1, and 30-3 (1957); Current Code: Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Must be reported by the third Tuesday after the election or when the candidate takes office, whichever is earlier.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Businesses that have business with the state, a county, or incorporated municipality involving consideration of $100,000 or more on a cumulative basis entered into during the 12 months immediately preceding the end of the reporting period are required to report all contributions to an incumbent or candidate political committee in excess of $100. This included the purchase of tickets, payment for admission to a dinner, BBQ, fish fry, or similar event, except for a bona fide gift by a spouse or relative within the 3rd degree of consanguinity, or honorary memberships in a social, service, or fraternal organization presented as a courtesy by the organization.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Must be reported by the third Tuesday after the election. Additional reports must be filed for non-continuing committees if there is a leftover cash balance or unpaid bills, 6 months after the general election or one year after the general election. A final report is required at the next upcoming reporting deadline when the cash has been exhausted and there are no more outstanding bills.

Disclosure_Citation: 2002 Md. Laws, Chap. 291, §4; Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Businesses that have business with the state, a county, or incorporated municipality involving consideration of $100,000 or more on a cumulative basis entered into during the 12 months immediately preceding the end of the reporting period are required to report all contributions to an incumbent or candidate political committee in excess of $100. This included the purchase of tickets, payment for admission to a dinner, BBQ, fish fry, or similar event, except for a bona fide gift by a spouse or relative within the 3rd degree of consanguinity, or honorary memberships in a social, service, or fraternal organization presented as a courtesy by the organization.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.

Disclosure_Citation: Old Code: Md. Ann. Code. art. 33 §§ 26-3, 26-4, 26-11, 30-1 et seq., 30-1, and 30-3 (1957); Current Code: Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.
CandDonorExplain: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Report must be filed by the earlier of the 3rd Tuesday after the general election or before taking office.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Businesses that have business with the state, a county, or incorporated municipality involving consideration of $10,000 or more on a cumulative basis entered into during the 12 months immediately preceding the end of the reporting period are required to report all contributions to an incumbent or candidate political committee in excess of $100. This included the purchase of tickets, payment for admission to a dinner, BBQ, fish fry, or similar event, except for a bona fide gift by a spouse or relative within the 3rd degree of consanguinity, or honorary memberships in a social, service, or fraternal organization presented as a courtesy by the organization.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine:
Report must be filed by the earlier of the 3rd Tuesday after the general election or before taking office.  Central and continuing committees must file annually on the date of the last general election.
Committees that are not central or continuing committees must file a report, if there is a surplus or deficit, 6 months after the general election, 1 year after the general election, and annually on the election anniversary until the surplus or deficit is eliminated.
PACDonorExplain: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
Report must be filed by the earlier of the 3rd Tuesday after the general election or before taking office.  Central and continuing committees must file annually on the date of the last general election.
Committees that are not central or continuing committees must file a report, if there is a surplus or deficit, 6 months after the general election, 1 year after the general election, and annually on the election anniversary until the surplus or deficit is eliminated.
BallotDonorExplain: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain:
Report must be filed by the earlier of the 3rd Tuesday after the general election or before taking office.  Central and continuing committees must file annually on the date of the last general election.
Committees that are not central or continuing committees must file a report, if there is a surplus or deficit, 6 months after the general election, 1 year after the general election, and annually on the election anniversary until the surplus or deficit is eliminated.

Disclosure_Citation: Colo. Rev. Stat. § 1-45-108 (2010); Colo. Const. Art. 28 § 7 (2010)
CandDonorExplain: Contributions of $100 or more require disclosure of occupation and employer.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: In addition to any report required to be filed with the secretary of state under this section, all candidate committees, political committees, issue committees, and political parties shall file a report with the secretary of state of any contribution of one thousand dollars or more at any time within thirty days preceding the date of the primary election or general election. This report shall be filed with the secretary of state no later than twenty-four hours after receipt of said contribution.
PartyDonorExplain: Contributions of $100 or more require disclosure of occupation and employer.

This report shall be filed with the secretary of state no later than twenty-four hours after receipt of said contribution.

CandDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution received by a candidate with opposition in an election or by the campaign treasurer or a deputy campaign treasurer of such a candidate on the day of that election or less than 5 days prior to the day of that election must be returned by him or her to the person or committee contributing it and may not be used or expended by or on behalf of the candidate.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.
PartyDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Party_PreElection_Regular: Friday before election

PartyFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.

PACFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions are prohibited.

CandDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution received by a candidate with opposition in an election or by the campaign treasurer or a deputy campaign treasurer of such a candidate on the day of that election or less than 5 days prior to the day of that election must be returned by him or her to the person or committee contributing it and may not be used or expended by or on behalf of the candidate.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.
PartyDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
Party_PreElection_Regular: Friday before the election
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution received by a state or county executive committee less than 5 days before an election shall not be used or expended in behalf of any candidate, issue, or political party participating in such election.
PartyFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions prohibited.
PACDonorExplain: If the contribution is $100 or less or from relative, occupation does not have to be disclosed. For corporations, the report must provide as clear a description as practicable of the principal type of business conducted by the corporation.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution received by the chair, campaign treasurer, or deputy campaign treasurer of a political committee supporting or opposing a candidate with opposition in an election or supporting or opposing an issue on the ballot in an election on the day of that election or less than 5 days prior to the day of that election may not be obligated or expended by the committee until after the date of the election.
PACFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Earmarked contributions are prohibited.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: In non election years, candidates must submit a disclosure report on June 30 and December 31. In election years, candidates must file  disclosure reports on March 31, June 30, September 30, and December 31. In election years, candidates must submit additional reports 6 days before any run-off primary or election in which the candidate is listed on the ballot. Additionally, state-wide candidates must report all contributions of $1,000 or more within 48 hours if the contributions are made between the time of the last report due prior to an election and the election itself. Candidates in special primary elections or special elections must file a report 15 days prior to the special primary or election. Candidates in special primary election runoffs or election runoffs must file a report 6 days prior to the election.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: A final disclosure report must be filed by December 31, of the election year.

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Candidates must submit a disclosure report 45 days and 15 days prior to a primary election and 15 days prior to a general or special election. Additionally, Candidates must file a final disclosure report by December 31, of the election year.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: A final disclosure report must be filed by December 31, of the election year.

Disclosure_Citation: Ga. Code Ann. § 21-5-34; Ga. Code Ann. § 21-5-34.1.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: In non election years, candidates must submit a disclosure report on January 31 and June 30. In election years, candidates must file  disclosure reports on January 31, March 31, June 30, September 30, October 25, and December 31. In election years, candidates must submit additional reports 6 days before any run-off primary or election in which the candidate is listed on the ballot. Additionally, state-wide candidates must report all contributions of $1,000 or more within two business days of receipt if the contributions are made between the time of the last report due prior to an election and the election itself. Candidates in special primary elections or special elections must file a report 15 days prior to the special primary or election. Candidates in special primary election runoffs or election runoffs must file a report 6 days prior to the election.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: A final disclosure report must be filed by December 31, of the election year.

Cand_PreElection_Regular: Not more than 14  days and not less than 7 days before the date of a general election
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Party_PreElection_Regular: Not more than 14  days and not less than 7 days before the date of a general election
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
PAC_PreElection_Regular: Not more than 14  days and not less than 7 days before the date of a general election
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Entity_DonorDisclose_Citation: 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws Ch. 379 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6606 (1998))

Entity_PreElection_Regular: Statement shall be filed within thirty (30) days of when the one thousand dollar ($ 1,000) threshold mentioned in subsection (1) of this section is exceeded

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Candidates must submit a disclosure report 45 days and 15 days prior to a primary election and 15 days prior to a general or special election. Additionally, Candidates must file a final disclosure report by December 31, of the election year.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: A final disclosure report must be filed by December 31, of the election year.

Disclosure_Citation: am §§ 6, 7 ch 6 SLA 1998; am § 1 ch 74 SLA 1998; Alaska Stat. § 15.13.040
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Each contribution or expenditure exceeding $250 (other than a contribution made by the candidate) made within nine days of the election must be reported to the Commission by date, amount, and contributor or recipient within 24 hours of receipt or expenditure.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Each contribution or expenditure exceeding $250 (other than a contribution made by the candidate) made within nine days of the election must be reported to the Commission by date, amount, and contributor or recipient within 24 hours of receipt or expenditure.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Each contribution or expenditure exceeding $250 (other than a contribution made by the candidate) made within nine days of the election must be reported to the Commission by date, amount, and contributor or recipient within 24 hours of receipt or expenditure.

CandDonorExplain: While candidates must disclose this information, there is no prohibition on depositing a contribution if the donor does not supply all of the information.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Late contributions must be reported within 24 hours of receipt or, in the case of contributions by candidates or committees, when the contribution was made. Late contributions are those of $1,000 or more. Any candidate or committee that makes a late in-kind contribution must notify the recipient in writing of the value of the contribution.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Late contributions must be reported within 24 hours of receipt or, in the case of contributions by candidates or committees, when the contribution was made. Late contributions are those of $1,000 or more. Any candidate or committee that makes a late in-kind contribution must notify the recipient in writing of the value of the contribution.

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: MN Laws 1974, c. 470, § 15; Current Code: MN ST §10A.15; 10A.20; 10A.16; 10A.02
CandDonorExplain: Occupation is only required if the contributor is self-employed.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution in excess of 2,000 for a statewide election or $400 for a legislative election received after the last report must be reported within 48 hours of receipt, either in person or certified mail. This does not apply to a primary if candidate is unopposed.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: A candidate or PAC shall not accept an earmarked contribution (a contribution from a source with the express or implied condition that the contribution be directed to a candidate other than the original recipeint).
PartyDonorExplain: Occupation is only required if contributor is self-employed
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution in excess of 2,000 for a statewide election or $400 for a legislative election received after the last report must be reported within 48 hours of receipt, either in person or certified mail. This does not apply to a primary if candidate is unopposed.

PACDonorExplain: Occupation is only required if contributor is self-employed

CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: A candidate or PAC shall not accept an earmarked contribution (a contribution from a source with the express or implied condition that the contribution be directed to a candidate other than the original recipeint).

CandDonorExplain: Occupation disclosure threshold is $151
Cand_PreElection_Regular: Eight days before primary election; six days before general election.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Candidate committees must file reports containing the name and address of each person who has made one or more contributions in an aggregate amount or value of $ 300 or more during the period commencing 11 days before a primary or general election at which a state or local officer is to be elected and ending at 11:59 p.m. on the Wednesday preceding the date of election. The report shall be made on or before the close of business on the Thursday preceding the date of the election.
PartyDonorExplain: Occupation disclosure threshold is 151
Party_PreElection_Regular: Eight days before primary election; six days before general election.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Party committees must file reports containing the name and address of each person who has made one or more contributions in an aggregate amount or value of $ 300 or more during the period commencing 11 days before a primary or general election at which a state or local officer is to be elected and ending at 11:59 p.m. on the Wednesday preceding the date of election. The report shall be made on or before the close of business on the Thursday preceding the date of the election. In addition, a separate report shall be made on a daily basis for the Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday immediately preceding the election. Each daily report shall contain the information required in paragraph (1) of this section. Each report shall be filed by 5:00 p.m. on the next day respectively.
PACDonorExplain: Occupation disclosure threshold is 151.
PAC_PreElection_Regular: Eight days before primary election; six days before general election.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: PACs must file reports containing the name and address of each person who has made one or more contributions in an aggregate amount or value of $ 300 or more during the period commencing 11 days before a primary or general election at which a state or local officer is to be elected and ending at 11:59 p.m. on the Wednesday preceding the date of election. The report shall be made on or before the close of business on the Thursday preceding the date of the election. In addition, a separate report shall be made on a daily basis for the Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday immediately preceding the election. Each daily report shall contain the information required in paragraph (1) of this section. Each report shall be filed by 5:00 p.m. on the next day respectively.

CandDonorExplain: If contributions by one contributor exceed $250, contributor's address, occupation, and major business affiliation must be disclosed.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Not less than 25 nor more than 30 days after each primary, general, or special election, candidate must submit statement including all financial transactions that have taken place since final pre-election disclosure report.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: When a contributor designates all or part of a contribution for the benefit of a particular candidate and makes the contriubtion to a committee acting with the approval or control of that candidate, the contribution is deemed to be an indirect contribution to the designated candidate.
PartyDonorExplain: If contributions by one contributor exceed $250, contributor's address, occupation, and major business affiliation must be disclosed.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Not less than 25 nor more than 30 days after each primary, general, or special election, committee must submit statement including all financial transactions that have taken place since final pre-election disclosure report.
PartyFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: When a contributor designates all or part of a contribution for the benefit of a particular candidate and makes the contriubtion to a committee acting with the approval or control of that candidate, the contribution is deemed to be an indirect contribution to the designated candidate.
PACDonorExplain: If contributions by one contributor exceed $250, contributor's address, occupation, and major business affiliation must be disclosed.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Not less than 25 nor more than 30 days after each primary, general, or special election, committee must submit statement including all financial transactions that have taken place since final pre-election disclosure report.
PACFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: When a contributor designates all or part of a contribution for the benefit of a particular candidate and makes the contriubtion to a committee acting with the approval or control of that candidate, the contribution is deemed to be an indirect contribution to the designated candidate.

Disclosure_Citation: 1995, c. 101; W. Va. Code § 3-8-5a; West Virginians for Life v. Smith, 960 F. Supp. 1036 (S.D. W. Va. 1996)

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Not less than 25 nor more than 30 days after each primary, general, or special election, candidate must submit statement including all financial transactions that have taken place since final pre-election disclosure report.  Also, on the last Saturday in September or within fifteen days thereafter next preceding the general election day whenever the total of all financial transactions relating to an election exceed five hundred dollars or whenever any loans are outstanding, a statement which shall include all financial transactions which have taken place by the date of such statement, subsequent to the previous statement.

Following reports are required:

Of all financial transactions which have taken place before the thirteenth day after each primary or other election and subsequent to the previous statement, if any, to be filed within four business days after the thirteenth day; and

CandDonorExplain: For individuals contributing more than $100 in aggregate, employer and occupation are reported. If more than $1,000, the committee must report if the individual or business with which the are associated has a contract with the state of more than $5,000
PartyDonorExplain: For individuals contributing more than $100 in aggregate, employer and occupation are reported. If more than $1,000, the committee must report if the individual or business with which the are associated has a contract with the state of more than $5,000
PACDonorExplain: For individuals contributing more than $100 in aggregate, employer and occupation are reported. If more than $1,000, the committee must report if the individual or business with which the are associated has a contract with the state of more than $5,000
BallotDonorExplain: For individuals contributing more than $100 in aggregate, employer and occupation are reported. If more than $1,000, the committee must report if the individual or business with which the are associated has a contract with the state of more than $5,000
Entity_DonorDisclose_Threshold_Explain: Lobbyists must report the name of each committee to which they or an immediate family member has contributed and the amount and date of each contribution

Disclosure_Citation: Ga. Code Ann. § 21-5-34; Ga. Code Ann. § 21-5-34.1.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: In non election years, candidates must submit a disclosure report on June 30 and December 31. In election years, candidates must file  disclosure reports on March 31, June 30, September 30, and December 31. In election years, candidates must submit additional reports 6 days before any run-off primary or election in which the candidate is listed on the ballot. Additionally, state-wide candidates must report all contributions of $1,000 or more within 48 hours if the contributions are made between the time of the last report due prior to an election and the election itself. Candidates in special primary elections or special elections must file a report 15 days prior to the special primary or election. Candidates in special primary election runoffs or election runoffs must file a report 6 days prior to the election.
Ballot_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explain: A final disclosure report must be filed by December 31, of the election year.

Disclosure_Citation: 1977 Idaho Sess. Laws  § 180 (Idaho Code. Ann. § 67-6612 (2015)); 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws  ch. 229 (Idaho Code Ann.  §  67-6610 (2015)); 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws  ch. 379 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6607 (2015)); 1999 Idaho Sess. Laws 29 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6611 (2015)).
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution greater than or equal to $1,000 received more than 48 hours before any primary or general election must be specially reported within 48 hours of receiving the contribution.
Entity_DonorDisclose_Citation: 1994 Idaho Sess. Laws Ch. 379 (Idaho Code Ann. § 67-6606 (2015))

Disclosure_Citation: 2002 Md. Laws, Chap. 291, §4; Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Businesses that have business with the state, a county, or incorporated municipality involving consideration of $100,000 or more on a cumulative basis entered into during the 12 months immediately preceding the end of the reporting period are required to report all contributions to an incumbent or candidate political committee in excess of $100. This included the purchase of tickets, payment for admission to a dinner, BBQ, fish fry, or similar event, except for a bona fide gift by a spouse or relative within the 3rd degree of consanguinity, or honorary memberships in a social, service, or fraternal organization presented as a courtesy by the organization.
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Address always reported. To extent practicable, if a donor has donated a cumulative amount of $500 or more to a campaign finance entity during an election cycle, the campaign entity's treasurer must report the donor's occupation and employer.

Disclosure_Citation: 2002 Md. Laws, Chap. 291, §4; Md. Election Law Code Ann. §§ 13-203, 13-221, 13-301 et seq.

CandDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: For all contributions = Name, address, amount contributed, and date of contribution; $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Contributions of $200 or more received after the closing date of the pre-election filing period (the closing date is the 16th day before the election) but received before the second day before the election, must be reported within 48 hours of reciept. The report must include name, address, occupation and employer, and the report must be written but need not contain an original signature.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: Contributions controlled by, or made at the direction of, another person, shall reported by the person making the contribution, and shall be regarded as a contribution attributable to both persons for purposes of contribution limits. Bundled contributions, or a contribution that is delivered as part of a bundled contribution, shall be reported as both a contribution attributable to the bundling committee that delivered the contribution and a contribution attributable to the individual making the contribution. Bundling committees must submit reports to both the Secretary of State and the candidate committee with the details of the contributions contained within a bundled contribution.
Cand_SpecialReport_Explained: Each fundraising event requires a special report, including the type of event, the date held, the address of the venue, the number of people in attendance, and the associated expenditures
PartyDonorExplain: Two different thresholds: For all contributions = Name, address, amount contributed, and date of contribution; $101 = Also must report occupation, employer, place of business
Party_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explaine: Contributions of $200 or more received after the closing date of the pre-election filing period (the closing date is the 16th day before the election) but received before the second day before the election, must be reported within 48 hours of reciept. The report must include name, address, occupation and employer, and the report must be written but need not contain an original signature.

Bundling committees must submit reports to the Secretary of State with the details of the contributions contained within a bundled contribution.

Disclosure_Citation: Session Law: MN Laws 1974, c. 470, § 15; Current Code: MN ST §10A.15; 10A.20; 10A.16; 10A.02
CandDonorExplain: Occupation is only required if the contributor is self-employed.
Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: Any contribution in excess of 2,000 for a statewide election or $400 for a legislative election received after the last report must be reported within 48 hours of receipt, either in person or certified mail. This does not apply to a primary if candidate is unopposed.
CandFile_BundlerEarmarked_Explained: A candidate or PAC shall not accept an earmarked contribution (a contribution from a source with the express or implied condition that the contribution be directed to a candidate other than the original recipeint).

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $500 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
Party_PreElection_Regular: 12, if it made an expenditure in that election
PAC_PreElection_Regular: 5 for PACs supporting statewide candidates and supporting or opposing ballot issues, and 12 for PACs that support candidates for the legislature or other state district office
PAC_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained:
PACs supporting statewide candidates = within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $500 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
PACs supporting or opposing ballot issues = within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $500 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
PACs supporting the legislature, the public service commission, or a district court judge, and political committees that are specifically organized to support or oppose a particular state district candidate = within 48 hours after receiving a contribution of $100 or more if received between the 17th day before the election and the day of the election

Cand_PreElection_SpecialReport_Explained: within 24 hours after receiving a contribution of $200 or more if received between the 10th day before the election and the day of the election
